episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and intriguing topics, including the vulnerability of British destroyer ships to warm water, a unique beauty contest in Singapore focused on internet skills, a network of fake apartments in the UK designed to catch burglars, and the world's largest skywriting firm declining a request to draw a giant penis in the sky.

facts.fact: The way to defeat the British Royal Navy's most advanced destroyer ship is to put it in warm water.
In 1988, Singapore held a beauty contest where 60% of the judging marks were awarded for how good a contestant's website was.
There is a network of fully furnished fake apartments in the UK, whose sole purpose is to get burgled.
The world's biggest skywriting firm recently turned down a request to draw the largest ever penis in the sky.
